subject: Productivity
title: Social Proof
description: A quick win: understand Social Proof.

hook.text: You pass two restaurants. One is empty, one has a line. You join the line. Everyone else did too.

buildup.text: Social proof means using other people's behavior as evidence for what's correct.

discovery.text: Robert Cialdini showed that hotel guests reuse towels far more when told most other guests do.

twist.text: Social proof can be manufactured. Fake reviews, inflated follower counts, and paid lines all exploit it.

climax.text: The shortcut works well in stable environments but fails when the crowd itself is misinformed.

punchline.text: Following the crowd saves time until it doesn't.

quiz.question: What is social proof?
options: Using others' behavior as evidence for what's correct
Proving your social status to others
A legal term for group contracts
